Tyler J. McRill
Software Engineer/Student in Columbus, Ohio

About Me

I am a third year computer science student at The Ohio State University. Aside from my schooling, last summer I worked as a software development intern for Trimble Transportation, where I aided in the enhancement of a web application tied with Microsoft Azure. Currently, I am working as a software engineer for Outern, a startup in the Columbus area.

With Outern, I have been a contributing member to the software development as well as the business decisions of the company from the beginning. I have learned how to develop and enhance a full-stack web application with ReactJS, employ a fully functional database using Google Cloud Firestore, and connect various external APIs.

Highlights

  • Built a full-stack application called Trimble Recruit with a team of interns using Angular, Python, and Google's Firestore.
  • Enhanced an already established web application within Trimble by connecting various departement's data into the application.
  • Incorporated video recording, full-text search, and back-end cloud functions into the Outern platform.
  • Outern team won the "People's Choice Award" at OSU's BOSS(Best of Student Startups) competition in 2019.

Interests

My personal interests include:

  • Startups. When I was younger, I was never sure if I wanted to start my own business. However, since I have been fortunate enough to work on Outern, I have discovered a love for the process of building a company. The idea of creating something brand new that doesn't already exist is an extremely fascinating idea to me.
  • Movies. All my life movies have seized my attention. Whether it be Star Wars when I was a kid, or movies like Goodfellas as I grow older, I have always enjoyed finding meaning from cinema.
  • Climbing. About two years ago I started rock climbing, and I haven't been the same since. I love all aspects of climbing, such as the movement of it, the challenge of it, and the satisfaction of it. I one day hope to make a free ascent of Yosemite's El Capitan.

Recent Projects

  • Outern is a platform that will give companies and students an entirely new way to interact in a work setting. Companies are able to offer students "Micro Internships" remotely, with the goal of building working relationships with said students that may eventually lead to an internship of a full-time hire. This application is being built using ReactJS, Google Cloud Firestore, and various Third-Party API's such as Stripe and Algolia.
  • Python based stock trading, using Alpaca's trading API. A work in progress, with the goal of automating the trading process fully.
